turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Radimlja.
turn.2: Radimlja  Radimlja is a stećak necropolis located near Stolac, Bosnia and Herzegovina.
turn.4: It is located in Vidovo polje, 3 km west of Stolac, on the Čapljina-Stolac road.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The Radimlja necropolis is one of the most valuable monuments of the mediaeval period in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
turn.8: The majority of its stećak tombstones date from the 1480s through the 16th century, as evidenced by the epitaph on one of the tombstones.
turn.9: What else is notable about it?
turn.10: This was the period when the Vlach family Miloradović-Stjepanović from genus Hrabren lived in the settlement located on near hill Ošanići.
turn.12: At the time the location was known as "Batnoge", and the creation of the necropolis coincides with the rise of the Vlachs.
